page.title: 01Camden Passage
page.content: Camden Passage. A landmark in Islington for hundreds of years, dating back to victorian times. Obfiosly, it has changed from a small group of stalls to a bustling reality of tourism with a cosmopolitan atmosphere. Most of the tourists are American, they are frequantly dishing out thousands of {Pounds} to buy another souviner or ornamint. A building larger than the others is the mall, formally a tram station if now houses an indoor market, one of the more moderate modernised parts of the passage. The antiques are of many cultures and nationally, grandfather clocks for England and Italy, or the enchanting, exotic tapistry carpets from Asia, all these fascinating objects are worth their vast prices.
